docs.lead_paragraph: The federal health insurance marketplace and its site are over budget and behind schedule because of “new and changing requirements” imposed by administration officials, investigators said.

headline.main: Investigators Warn of Possible Perils in Fall With Health Site
headline.print_headline: New Troubles Seen for Federal Insurance Marketplace

docs.abstract: Government Accountability Office raises concerns that federal health insurance marketplace and its website remains over budget and behind schedule due to shifting requirements imposed by administration officials; testimony raises questions about whether marketplace will be ready to enroll millions more people in the fall.
docs.snippet: The federal health insurance marketplace and its site are over budget and behind schedule because of “new and changing requirements” imposed by administration officials, investigators said.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: In a 225-to-201 party-line vote, Republicans authorized the House to move forward with a lawsuit against President Obama for his application of the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: House Votes to Sue Obama for Overstepping Powers
headline.print_headline: House Votes to Sue Obama for Overstepping Powers

docs.abstract: House of Representatives votes to sue Pres Obama for overstepping the powers of the presidency in his application of the Affordable Care Act; move angers conservatives who call it insufficient, emboldens Democrats who say Republicans are being vengeful, and further erodes much of what is left of bipartisanship on Capitol Hill.
docs.snippet: In a 225-to-201 party-line vote, Republicans authorized the House to move forward with a lawsuit against President Obama for his application of the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Setting up a plan is considerably easier and cheaper than it was just a decade ago, and it helps in recruiting and retaining employees over the long term.

headline.main: Many Reasons to Offer 401(k)s (Including Owner’s Retirement)
headline.print_headline: Many Reasons to Offer 401(k)s (Including Owner’s Retirement)

docs.abstract: Setting up a 401(k) plan at a small business is considerably easier and cheaper than it was just a decade ago, and it helps in recruiting and retaining employees over the long term; Capital One says plans are still the exception at small companies, with only 25 percent offering them.
docs.snippet: Setting up a plan is considerably easier and cheaper than it was just a decade ago, and it helps in recruiting and retaining employees over the long term.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Paul Kagame must set the country on a path that leads to a democratic transition.
docs.snippet: President Paul Kagame must set the country on a path that leads to a democratic transition.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ten months after the botched rollout of HealthCare.gov, Obamacare's federal health insurance exchange is still dogged by cost overruns and technology delays that could hamper enrollment when it resumes in November, a U.S. watchdog said.

headline.main: Federal Obamacare Market Still Faces Cost Overruns, Delays: Watchdog
headline.print_headline: Federal Obamacare Market Still Faces Cost Overruns, Delays: Watchdog

docs.snippet: Ten months after the botched rollout of HealthCare.gov, Obamacare's federal health insurance exchange is still dogged by cost overruns and technology delays that could hamper enrollment when it resumes in November, a U.S. watchdog said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress is set to adopt a landmark bill to help veterans avoid long waits for health care, hire more doctors and nurses to treat them and make it easier to fire senior executives at the Veterans Affairs Department. The House approved the bill Wednesday, with a Senate vote expected by the end of the week.

headline.main: What's in Bill to Overhaul VA
headline.print_headline: What's in Bill to Overhaul VA

docs.lead_paragraph: Management failures by the Obama administration set the stage for computer woes that paralyzed the president's new health care program last fall, nonpartisan investigators said in a report released Wednesday.
